page.title: 03Important Places (contd.)
page.content: Strip Lynchets are found to the south of Bishopstone.These were used in Medieval times. They would have grown all sorts of crops on long rectangular steps. Now it is just grass land.You can see the strip lynchets from a few miles away. The Ridgeway is a public footpath you can go for walks and it is mainly grass land but there are a few fields with crops in by the side.It is a very old trackI ackway.It was used as a drovers road.SheeheeI ep were taken part of the way to London.I go on sponsored walks on the Ridgeway. The Ridgeway links up with major field systems and minor track ways leading off the Ridgeway from Uffington to the Thames.
